config.question: Which of the following occurred as a consequence of the Panic of 1893?

choices.content: Unemployment rose to one out of four workers.
There was nationwide demand for a gold standard.
The Sherman Silver Purchase Act was implemented.

answer_3.response: In May of 1893, businesses failed at an average rate of two dozen a day. An estimated 2 million people, or nearly 15 percent of the labor force, were unemployed. The year 1894 was even worse. The gross national product dropped again. By midyear, 3 million workers, one out of every five, were unemployed.
